verses.verse: <WG1161> After<WG3326> the uproar<WG2351> had ceased,<WG3973> Paul<WG3972> sent for<WG4341> the disciples,<WG3101> <WG2532> took leave<WG782> of them,<WG1831> and departed to go<WG4198> into<WG1519> Macedonia.<WG3109>
When<WG1161> he had gone through<WG1330> those<WG1565> parts,<WG3313> and<WG2532> had encouraged<WG3870> them<WG846> with many<WG4183> words,<WG3056> he came<WG2064> into<WG1519> Greece.<WG1671>

<WG5037> When he had spent<WG4160> three<WG5140> months<WG3376> there,<WG1096> and <WG5259> a plot<WG1917> was made against him<WG846> by Jews<WG2453> as he was about<WG3195> to set sail<WG321> for<WG1519> Syria,<WG4947> he<WG1096> determined<WG1106> to return<WG5290> through<WG1223> Macedonia.<WG3109>

These<WG1161> accompanied<WG4902> him<WG846> as far as<WG891> Asia:<WG773> Sopater<WG4986> of Beroea;<WG961> <WG1161> Aristarchus<WG708> and<WG1161> Secundus<WG4580> of the Thessalonians;<WG2331> <WG2532> Gaius<WG1050> of Derbe;<WG1190> <WG2532> Timothy;<WG5095> and<WG2532> Tychicus<WG5190> and<WG1161> Trophimus<WG5161> of Asia.<WG774>
But these<WG3778> had gone ahead,<WG4281> and were waiting<WG3306> for us<WG2248> at<WG1722> Troas.<WG5174>

<WG1161> We<WG2249> sailed away<WG1602> from<WG575> Philippi<WG5375> after<WG3326> the days<WG2250> of Unleavened Bread,<WG106> and<WG2532> came<WG2064> to<WG4314> them<WG846> at<WG1519> Troas<WG5174> in<WG891> five<WG4002> days,<WG2250> where<WG3757> we stayed<WG1304> seven<WG2033> days.<WG2250>

<WG1722> On<WG1161> the first<WG1520> day of the week,<WG4521> when<WG4863> the disciples<WG3101> were gathered together<WG4863> to break<WG2806> bread,<WG740> Paul<WG3972> talked<WG1256> with them,<WG846> intending<WG3195> to depart<WG1826> on the next day,<WG1887> and<WG5037> continued<WG3905> his speech<WG3056> until<WG3360> midnight.<WG3317>
There<WG1161> were<WG2258> many<WG2425> lights<WG2985> in<WG1722> the upper room<WG5253> where<WG3757> we were<WG2258> gathered together.<WG4863>

<WG1161> A certain<WG5100> young man<WG3494> named<WG3686> Eutychus<WG2161> sat<WG2521> in<WG1909> the window,<WG2376> weighed down<WG2702> with deep<WG901> sleep.<WG5258> As<WG1909> Paul<WG3972> spoke<WG1256> still<WG1256> longer,<WG4119> being weighed down<WG2702> by<WG575> his sleep,<WG5258> he fell down<WG4098> from<WG575> the third story,<WG5152> and<WG2532> was taken<WG142> up<WG2736> dead.<WG3498>

<WG1161> Paul<WG3972> went down,<WG2597> and<WG1161> fell<WG1968> upon him,<WG846> and<WG2532> embracing<WG4843> him said,<WG2036> "Don't<WG3361> be troubled,<WG2350> for<WG1063> his<WG846> life<WG5590> is<WG2076> in<WG1722> him.<WG846>"

When<WG1161> he had gone up,<WG305> and<WG2532> had broken<WG2806> bread,<WG740> and<WG5037> eaten,<WG1089> and<WG2532> had talked<WG3656> with them a<WG1909> long while,<WG2425> even until<WG891> break of day,<WG827> he<WG3779> departed.<WG1831>
They<WG1161> brought<WG71> the boy<WG3816> in alive,<WG2198> and<WG1161> were<WG3870> <WG3756> greatly<WG3357> comforted.<WG3870>

But<WG1161> we<WG2249> who went ahead<WG4281> to<WG1909> the ship<WG4143> set sail<WG321> for<WG1519> Assos,<WG789> intending<WG3195> to take<WG353> Paul<WG3972> aboard there,<WG1564> for<WG1063> he had<WG2258> so<WG3779> arranged,<WG1299> intending<WG3195> himself<WG846> to go by land.<WG3978>
<WG1161> When<WG5613> he met<WG4820> us<WG2254> at<WG1519> Assos,<WG789> we took<WG353> him<WG846> aboard,<WG353> and came<WG2064> to<WG1519> Mitylene.<WG3412>

Sailing<WG636> from there,<WG2547> we came<WG2658> the following<WG1966> day opposite<WG481> Chios.<WG5508> The<WG1161> next<WG1966> day we touched<WG3846> at<WG1519> Samos<WG4544> and<WG1161> stayed<WG3306> at<WG1722> Trogyllium,<WG5175> and the day after<WG2192> we came<WG2064> to<WG1519> Miletus.<WG3399>

For<WG1063> Paul<WG3972> had determined<WG2919> to sail past<WG3896> Ephesus,<WG2181> that<WG3704> he<WG846> might<WG1096> not<WG3361> have to spend time<WG5551> in<WG1722> Asia;<WG773> for<WG1063> he was hastening,<WG4692> if<WG1487> it were<WG2258> possible<WG1415> for him,<WG846> to be<WG1096> in<WG1519> Jerusalem<WG2414> on the day<WG2250> of Pentecost.<WG4005>
<WG1161> From<WG575> Miletus<WG3399> he sent<WG3992> to<WG1519> Ephesus,<WG2181> and called<WG3333> to himself the elders<WG4245> of the assembly.<WG1577>

<WG1161> When<WG5613> they had come<WG3854> to<WG4314> him,<WG846> he said<WG2036> to them,<WG846> "You<WG5210> yourselves know,<WG1987> from<WG575> the first<WG4413> day<WG2250> <WG2250> that<WG3739> I set foot<WG1910> in<WG1519> Asia,<WG773> how<WG4459> I was<WG1096> with<WG3326> you<WG5216> all<WG3956> the time,<WG5550>

serving<WG1398> the Lord<WG2962> with<WG3326> all<WG3956> humility,<WG5012> with<WG2532> many<WG4183> tears,<WG1144> and<WG2532> with trials<WG3986> which happened<WG4819> to me<WG3427> by<WG1722> the plots<WG1917> of the Jews;<WG2453>

how<WG5613> I didn't<WG5288> shrink from declaring to you<WG5213> anything<WG3762> that was profitable,<WG4851> teaching<WG1321> you<WG5213> publicly<WG1219> and<WG2532> from<WG2596> house to house,<WG3624>

testifying<WG1263> both<WG5037> to Jews<WG2453> and<WG2532> to Greeks<WG1672> repentance<WG3341> toward<WG1519> God,<WG2316> and<WG2532> faith<WG4102> toward<WG1519> our<WG2257> Lord<WG2962> <WG5547> Jesus.<WG2424>

<WG2532> Now,<WG3568> behold,<WG2400> I<WG1473> go<WG4198> bound<WG1210> by the Spirit<WG4151> to<WG1519> Jerusalem,<WG2419> not<WG3361> knowing<WG1492> what<WG3588> <WG1722> will happen<WG4876> to me<WG3427> there;<WG846>

except<WG4133> that<WG3754> the Holy<WG40> Spirit<WG4151> testifies<WG1263> in<WG2596> every city,<WG4172> saying<WG3004> that<WG3754> bonds<WG1199> and<WG2532> afflictions<WG2347> wait<WG3306> for me.<WG3165>

But<WG235> these things<WG3056> don't<WG3762> count;<WG4160> nor<WG3761> do I<WG2192> hold my<WG3450> life<WG5590> dear<WG5093> to myself,<WG1683> so<WG5613> that I<WG2192> may finish<WG5048> my<WG3450> race with<WG3326> joy,<WG5479> and<WG2532> the ministry<WG1248> which<WG3739> I received<WG2983> from the Lord<WG2962> Jesus,<WG2424> to fully testify<WG1263> to the Good News<WG2098> of the grace<WG5485> of God.<WG2316>

<WG2532> "Now,<WG3568> behold,<WG2400> I<WG1473> know<WG1492> that<WG3754> you<WG5210> all,<WG3956> among<WG1722> whom<WG3739> I went<WG1330> about preaching<WG2784> the Kingdom<WG932> of God,<WG2316> will see<WG3700> my<WG3450> face<WG4383> no more.<WG3765>
Therefore<WG1352> I<WG1722> testify<WG3143> to<WG1722> you<WG5213> this<WG4594> day<WG2250> that<WG3754> I<WG1473> am clean<WG2513> from<WG575> the blood<WG129> of all men,<WG3956>
for<WG1063> I<WG5288> didn't<WG3756> shrink<WG5288> from<WG3361> declaring<WG312> to you<WG5213> the whole<WG3956> counsel<WG1012> of God.<WG2316>

Take heed,<WG4337> therefore,<WG3767> to yourselves,<WG1438> and<WG2532> to all<WG3956> the flock,<WG4168> in<WG1722> which<WG3739> the Holy<WG40> Spirit<WG4151> has made<WG5087> you<WG5209> overseers,<WG1985> to shepherd<WG4165> the assembly<WG1577> of the Lord and God<WG2316> which<WG3739> he purchased<WG4046> with<WG1223> his own<WG2398> blood.<WG129>

For<WG1063> I<WG1473> know<WG1492> <WG3754> that<WG3754> after<WG3326> my<WG3450> departure,<WG867> vicious<WG926> wolves<WG3074> will enter<WG1525> in among<WG1519> you,<WG5209> not<WG3361> sparing<WG5339> the flock.<WG4168>

<WG2532> Men<WG435> will<WG435> arise<WG450> from among<WG1537> your<WG5216> own selves,<WG846> speaking<WG2980> perverse things,<WG1294> to draw away<WG645> the disciples<WG3101> after<WG3694> them.<WG846>

Therefore<WG1352> watch,<WG1127> remembering<WG3421> that<WG3754> for a period of three years<WG5148> I didn't<WG3756> cease<WG3973> to admonish<WG3560> everyone<WG1538> <WG1520> night<WG3571> and<WG2532> day<WG2250> with<WG3326> tears.<WG1144>
Now, brothers, I entrust you to God, and to the word of his grace, which is able to build up, and to give you the inheritance among all those who are sanctified.
I coveted no one's silver, or gold, or clothing.
You yourselves know that these hands served my necessities, and those who were with me.
In all things I gave you an example, that so laboring you ought to help the weak, and to remember the words of the Lord Jesus, that he himself said, "'It is more blessed to give than to receive.'"
When he had spoken these things, he knelt down and prayed with them all.
They all wept a lot, and fell on Paul's neck and kissed him,
sorrowing most of all because of the word which he had spoken, that they should see his face no more. And they accompanied him to the ship.
